content.description:
The face to the right of One Vision with three bolts. Climb this bolted face to a roof. Plug a cam (0.3  0.75 C4) or big nut into the roof crack and pull the last move to a ledge above. Looking up with Cracktacular on your left and One Vision straight ahead, you will see a grassy ramp to your right. Follow this grassy ramp and then continue uphill until you gain a little terrace in front of a large, fallen tree with a spider-filled corner to the climbers left. From here, you can see all three bolts. Mixed (3 Bolts)
Tree Anchor (Sling with rap ring)

A small 8 scramble will bring you to a wet ledge at the base of the crack. This beautiful crack ranges in size requiring various crack climbing techniques and is a great asset to the area.

On the right hand side of the Queen wall there is a right facing corner with a very nice 40 foot long vertical crack.
Standard rack to 3".

Start by scrambling on easy terrain and large holds to the first bolt. Continue straight up at the bolt through stout moves on some loose-ish rock. After clipping the second bolt the climbing is a mixed between the arête and face resulting in outstanding climbing all the way to the anchor.

This climb is located on the queen wall to the right of Cracktacular. This cliff is past the main wall and accessed by walking the trail in front of the king wall for another 75.
4bolt, 2 raprings.

Climbs the sharp arete left of 5.10eh.



Upper cliff by 5.10eh

Bolts

Start by gaining the ledge right of Dressed for Success, clip the first bolt from this ledge. After clipping another bolt climb up into the corner. Follow the corner past 3 bolts to the bolted anchor.  
 Shares the same anchor as Dressed for Success.  

Up the hill from the main wall, the furthest right line on the Queen wall.
5 bolts, rap rings

Stick clip 1st bolt. Start on the sloping ramp under the first bolt; make short burly moves on the arête like feature to gain a rail. Follow the rail leading you into the corner right of the first bolt. Follow the left trending corner passed 2 bolts; a tricky sequence will finish at a 2 bolt rap station. This is a great line that will leave you pumped. This route starts infront of the large stump located on the left side of the Queen wall. stick clip first bolt,
3 bolts 2 rap rings

This wall is located up 40m up the trail from the king wall. This wall is 40 tall and offers some of the steepest climbing at Kingston. Greg Hughes spent time in 09 and 10 cleaning and installing anchors for this wall, and then Cory Hall and PJ Adamson took the project over developing some of the hardest routes in the area.
